text:
we use Veeam and run server 2019 hyper-v. The way we interpreted the issue was that patching the hyper-v host would trigger the issue, so we are planning on just patching VMs, not the hosts, until there is a real resolution. https://borncity.com/win/2023/10/17/windows-server-2019-2022-updates-kb5031361-kb5031364-cause-hyper-v-issues/
 There is a Veeam forum posting about a MS "fix" for an RCT issue https://forums.veeam.com/microsoft-hyper-v-f25/windows-server-2019-hyper-v-vm-i-o-performance-problem-t62112-360.html#p500560
